SEARCH
Module it.polimi.ingsw.am52
Package it.polimi.ingsw.am52.network.server

Class ServerConnection

java.lang.Object
java.rmi.server.RemoteObject
java.rmi.server.RemoteServer
java.rmi.server.UnicastRemoteObject
it.polimi.ingsw.am52.network.server.ServerConnection
All Implemented Interfaces:
Accepter, Serializable, Runnable, Remote
public class ServerConnection extends UnicastRemoteObject implements Accepter, Runnable
The ServerConnection class, it handles all the connection establishing in the Server. Initialize both TCP and RMI connections and takes reference to all clientHandler running instances.
See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • ServerConnection

      public ServerConnection(ServerSettings settings) throws RemoteException, IllegalArgumentException
      Initialize the ServerConnection, Creates the ServerSocket and exports the ServerConnection to the network.
      Parameters:
      settings - The server startup settings
      Throws:
      RemoteException - If the socket creation fails.
      IllegalArgumentException - If any settings' value is not valid (detail in the exception message)

  • Method Details

    • displayStartupSettings

      private void displayStartupSettings(ServerSettings settings)

    • openTcpServerSocket

      private ServerSocket openTcpServerSocket(int socketPort, PortMode portMode) throws IOException
      Create a socket for the TCP connection.
      Parameters:
      socketPort - The port number the socket shall be bound to
      portMode - The method for selecting the port number (fixed or auto)
      Returns:
      The server socket instance
      Throws:
      IOException - If the socket creation failed
      IllegalArgumentException - If the specified port number is invalid.

    • run

      public void run()
      Endless loop method, listening to client to connect to the ServerSocket. When a client tries to connect to the server a new unique ID is generated and a new ClientHandlerTCP is created. The Handler object is on server side.
      Specified by:
      run in interface Runnable

    • accept

      public int accept(RemoteConnection client) throws RemoteException
      Method exposed to the network by the Server and called by the client. It generates a new ID, creates the ClientHandleRMI to handle the RMI client. Expose the linked VirtualView in the network with the id of the client. Add the client to the server and runs it.
      Specified by:
      accept in interface Accepter
      Parameters:
      client - The client object that will be called to forward the message of broadcast
      Throws:
      RemoteException - Implementation of Remote interface

    • getTcpPort

      public int getTcpPort()
      Returns:
      The TCP port number of this server.
